meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I sent a letter to my friend.
meanings.sent2: She sent an email to her boss this morning.
meanings.sent3: The pigeon sent a message to its friends with a tiny scroll.
meanings.sent4: His words sent a wave of excitement through the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The wind sent the leaves dancing in the air.

meanings.definition: to cause to go or be taken to a destination
meanings.sent1: The captain sent the ship towards the harbor.
meanings.sent2: The teacher sent the students to the library for research.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf sent the cookies flying across the room.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter sent happiness to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The rocket sent the satellite into orbit around the Earth.
